poem:
**The Gallaghers in Headlines**

Anger, a flashbulb popping in the dark,
casting shadows long as another century.
But see now how the brothers turn,
eyes meeting in a practiced smile,
glass shards of memory swept aside
as chords strum their familiar tune,
and the crowd, a second family,
sings them back together.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Anger is blinding’: family therapists on how to resolve sibling feuds For most of the 1990s and 2000s, the Gallagher brothers clashed on stage and traded high-profile insults in newspaper interviews and on social media. So rumours of an Oasis reunion tour in 2025 have prompted furious speculation about how the pair repaired a rift that for decades appeared intractable. Family therapists told the Guardian that although sibling rifts are common and often reparable, reunions". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
